meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone by making them believe something that is not true.
meanings.sent1: She was outbluffing her friend by pretending to have a secret treasure map.
meanings.sent2: The detective was outbluffing the suspect during the interrogation.
meanings.sent3: The magician was outbluffing the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was outbluffing his way into the wealthy social circles.
meanings.sent5: The spy was outbluffing the enemy agents with her clever disguises.

meanings.definition: To outsmart or outwit someone by using cunning or deception.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox was outbluffing the hunters by leading them in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent2: The chess grandmaster was outbluffing his opponent with a surprise move.
meanings.sent3: The students were outbluffing the teacher by passing notes during the lesson.
meanings.sent4: The hacker was outbluffing the security system to gain unauthorized access.
meanings.sent5: The escape artist was outbluffing the guards with his daring escape plan.
